key_mistakes.reason: Gives White more control of the center, allowing e5 was preferable.
Misses opportunity to strengthen central control with pawn.
Misses developing the knight to a natural square.
Does not address the threat on the center.
Allows Black to trade pieces favorably.
A passive move when f4 could have been more active.
Allows tactical opportunities for the opponent.
Blunder that gives the opponent a significant advantage.
Blunder that worsens White's position significantly.

recommendations: Focus on maintaining central control, especially in the opening phase.
Ensure proper piece development before initiating pawn moves.
Avoid unnecessary pawn moves that do not contribute to central control or piece activity.
Be cautious about tactical opportunities that could favor the opponent.
